docs.title: 1. Why we use the docker " " command?
docs.text:
-it is short for --interactive + --tty. When you docker run with this command it takes you straight inside the container.

-d is short for --detach, which means you just run the container and then detach from it. Essentially, you run container in the background.

So, if you run the Docker container with -itd, it runs both the -it options and detaches you from the container. As a result, your container will still be running in the background even without any default app to run.

docs.title: 1. How to see which kernel version a system is running?
docs.text:
• uname ["uname" prints out system information]
  • uname -a ["uname" with "-a" flag will give us everything it has on the system]
  • uname -v [It will print out kernel version]
  • uname -r [it will print out kernel release]

docs.title: 2. How can we check our current ip address?
docs.text:
• ifconfig [it will printout everything, IPv4, IPv6, broadcast, subnetmask(mask), loopback(lp)]
  • ip addr show [it will give us all the information]
  • ip addr show eth0 [this will give us all the information regarding eth0]

docs.title: 3. How do we check for free disk space?
docs.text: • df -ah [disk free, all files, human readble] [this will give us read of all the files on our system] the above command will show us the root partition and the hard drive partition

docs.title: 4. How do we manages services on a system? (how do we know if a service is running, how do we start and stop service)
docs.text: • systemctl status _name_of_the_service

docs.title: 5. How would we check the size of a directories content on the disk?
docs.text: • du -sh name_of_directory [to print the size occupied in the disk]

docs.title: 6. How would we check for open ports in the linux machine?
docs.text:
• netstat [gives all the information]
  • netstat -tulpn [t- TEC, u- UDP, l- lisening, pn- port number]
  • sudo netstat -tulpn [running as root will show us all the PID/Processes]

docs.title: 7. How would we check CPU usage of a given process?
docs.text:
• ps aux | grep name_of_the_process
  • top
  • htop [required to be installed]

docs.title: 8. How would we deal with mount of new memory?
docs.text:
• ls /mnt
  • mount /dev/sda2/ /mnt [mount address and mount point]
  • mount [check for any mount, pass the keyword "mount" without any arguments]

docs.title: 9. If we want to mount a volume at the boot what file would we look in ?
docs.text: • less etc/fstab

docs.title: 10. How to look up mannual in linux system?
docs.text: • man _name_of_the_command_we_are_looking_for
